title: REVIEW  ---  Play:  News Quiz  ----  By Daniel Akst
text:
1. Sheryl Sandberg said she'll step down as COO of Facebook's parent. Where was she hired from 14 years ago?

A. Apple

B. Google

C. Procter and Gamble

D. Stanford

---

2. The U.S. and China are racing to develop a new breed of missiles. What type are these?

A. Satellite-based

B. Cruise

C. Ballistic

D. Hypersonic

---

3. The Fed began shrinking its $9 trillion asset portfolio -- how?

A. By listing bonds on eBay

B. By periodically auctioning bonds

C. By marking down bond values each quarter

D. By not reinvesting the proceeds of some bonds when they mature

---

4. What have coal prices done this year?

A. Soared

B. Plunged

C. Remained stable

D. Become a lot more opaque

---

5. Per the U.N., who now has enough highly enriched uranium to make a nuclear bomb?

A. North Korea

B. Saudi Arabia

C. Iran

D. Pakistan

---

6. A jury awarded Johnny Depp $15 million in his defamation battle with Amber Heard. How much was she awarded?

A. Nothing

B. $1

C. $2 million

D. $10.4 million

---

7. Which CEO just told employees to spend at least 40 hours a week at the office?

A. David Solomon (Goldman Sachs)

B. Mary Barra (GM)

C. Jamie Dimon (JPMorgan Chase)

D. Elon Musk (Tesla)

---

8. People in long-term relationships can reignite the spark, said a Kinsey Institute expert, since "Great sex is all about having..." What?

A. "The right outlook"

B. "The right partner"

C. "The right diet"

D. "The right bed"

---

9. Britons celebrated Queen Elizabeth II's 70 years on the throne. Who did she succeed as monarch?

A. Elizabeth I

B. Edward VIII

C. George VI

D. Victoria

---

ANSWERS

1. B

2. D

3. D

4. A

5. C

6. C

7. D

8. A

9. C
